page.title: 06East Town Hamlet
page.content:
1.5km east of West Ashton village lies the small hamlet of East Town. The reason for the hamlets existence is obscure, for historically it was sited in the middle of the common field system.It is probably pre 11th.c in origin, and the earliest known name for the settlement is{* Saucer's {Ashton,}after a family of the same name. In its present form the hamlet consists of a cluster of houses round a sharp bend in the road and a farm, with 2 farm workers cottages. The large farmhouse bears the date 1638 over the front door. Life in the small community of 7 families centres around the farm. As there are no amenities e.g. shop, pub,
{* Researched by Mr. K. Rogers, County {Archivist and resident of East Town.
